lexUnit.name: incapacitate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause something to stop functioning

sentence.text: In addition , my Grandfather , for twenty-odd years prior to his death , at the age of seventy two in 1907 , suffered from a chest condition which incapacitated him each winter .
In fact , the belief that menstruation incapacitated women seems to have increased amongst some ` experts " , though they were constantly challenged .
Nizan 's writings are not those of a man incapacitated by the restrictions of party dogma .
Symbolically the owl sits on an Evil Eye that has been pierced by a spear , suggesting that the owl 's own ` Evil Eye " has been incapacitated by the mobbing display .
There was a deep belief , even amongst many women , that biology had incapacitated them , and this was sustained by expert opinion .
Their most damaging impacts were the introduction of diseases and alcohol addiction , which incapacitated and occasionally destroyed whole communities ( ibid . ) .
It more or less incapacitated me from any activity .

This incapacitates them temporarily ; whilst imprisoned they can not victimize the public , although they do continue to victimize other prisoners , sometimes at a rate that exceeds community crime levels .
They 're apt to incapacitate us in the present if we do n't vigilantly sweep them away . "
I have in fact only once been incapacitated , on that occasion by a severe attack of malaria .
` I said we were to incapacitate the aircraft , not destroy it , " Marshka said when Vashinov had finished his report .
Atwater had become increasingly incapacitated by an inoperable brain tumour during the last year of his life .
Fabio had pointed out that there was no knowing how long Mario 's leg would incapacitate him .
He gave up his business interests in 1958 , when he was partially incapacitated by coronary thrombosis .
Corporate executives could be incapacitated by imprisonment ; whilst inside they could not be victimizing employees , consumers , share-holders , or the general public .
There would have to be several men involved in the racket , McCloy himself , two or three men to commandeer the lorry and incapacitate the driver as well as Hatton .
It is therefore untrue that menstruation is a disability that inordinately incapacitates women .
Rod Hale and Grant Parrott both sustained injuries which incapacitated them in various ways .
Such people should be diagnosed by experts and given appropriate treatment which will prevent them from re-offending ; if necessary they can be detained to incapacitate them in the meantime .
Constitutionally , the President of the Assembly would assume the functions of the Croatian President should the latter be incapacitated .
He suffered from the kind of hypersensitivity which , unchecked or unguarded , would have incapacitated him .
Some pilots are completely incapacitated by even gentle nose-down pitching movements .
He did so ` to incapacitate him -- to make him realise he had just injured one of my colleagues . "
Even if the prey is not killed outright , there is a greater chance that it will be incapacitated .
